poem:
Title: The Currency of Youth

The red promise proffers,
no shadows cast on worn coins.
Rishi, mind of the dawn,
conjures service from spring's youths,
the choice - a blade or a hand. 

Nineteen's bloom, now currency 
for the country's heart, for community's skin.
In the covid-retold stories -
both choices, a kind of bravery.
Ah, the cost of pandemic mornings.
